items.prompt: for nicks, security, and oil leaks
Do not operate with less than nine quarts.
Fill to twelve quarts for extended flight.
3-6 strokes (none if engine is warm). Check in and locked
- Mixture full rich when engine fires and throttle to idle promptly.
reset to 1000 RPM as engine warms up
lean => RPM drop, enrich to peak RPM, three 1/2 turns rich
RPM dip, then oil pressure dip
L, Both, R, Both: ≤150 RPM drop ≤ 50 RPM difference
mixture may be leaned above 5000 feet
0º to 10º below 140 KIAS, 10º to 40º below 95 KIAS
apply full heat before closing throttle
0º TO 10º below 140 KIAS, 10º TO 40º below 95 KIAS
L, R, then OFF, back R
mixture may be leaned above 5000 feet
or START if propeller is stopped
as described in Emergency Landing Without Engine Power
High Winds, Heavy Seas -- INTO THE WIND.
Light Winds, Heavy Swells -- PARALLEL TO SWELLS
If no power is available, approach at 70 KIAS with flaps up or at 65 KIAS with 10º flaps.

items.expectation: CUSHION AT TOUCHDOWN WITH FOLDED COAT

checklists.title: Landing With A Flat Main Tire

items.prompt: hold airplane off flat tire as long as possible with aileron control
so airplane will rotate to horizontal attitude for touchdown
If fire is not extinguished, increase glide speed to find an airspeed which will provide an incombustible mixture
as described in Emergency Landing Without Engine Power
After discharging an extinguisher within a closed cabin, ventilate the cabin.
and electrical power is necessary for continuance of flight:
for faulty circuit, do not reset
one at a time, with delay after each until short circuit is localized
when it is ascertained that fire is completely extinguished
After discharging an extinguisher within a closed cabin, ventilate the cabin
Perform a sideslip to keep the flames away from the fuel tank and cabin, and land as soon as possible using flaps only as required for final approach and touchdown.
Turn back or change altitude to obtain an outside air temperature that is less conducive to icing
to minimize build up on propeller blades
Lean the mixture if carburetor heat is used continuously
With an extremely rapid ice build-up, select a suitable " off airport" landing site
With an ice accumulation of 1/4 inch or more on the wing leading
edges, be prepared for significantly higher stall speed
Open left window and if practical scrape ice from a portion of the windshield for visibility in the landing approach
if necessary during landing approach, for improved visibility
depending upon the amount of ice accumulation
monitor RPM for "decrease then increase" as carburetor ice melts

checklists.title: Ammeter Shows Excessive Rate Of Charge

items.prompt: Illumination of the low-voltage light may occur during low RPM conditions with an electrical load on the system such as during a low RPM taxi. Under these conditions, the light will go out at higher RPM. The master switch need not be recycled since an over-voltage condition has not occurred to deactivate the alternator system.
compass heading should be the reciprocal of the original heading
to minimize compass card swings due to changing bank angles

In addition, keep hands off the control wheel and steer a straight course with rudder control by monitoring the turn coordinator. Occasionally check the compass heading and make minor corrections to hold an approximate course.
by using coordinated aileron and rudder control
cautiously to slowly reduce the indicated airspeed to 80 KIAS
Keep hands off the control wheel, using rudder control to hold straight heading. Use rudder trim to relieve unbalanced rudder force, if present.
